page.title: 13A HISTORY OF OUR SCHOOL
page.content: OUR SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN 1886 THE ROLL WAS THEN 120 PUPILS,AGED BETWEEN 5 AND 14 YEARS. THE HEADMASTER WAS MR. ALEXANDER GIBSON AND THERE WAS ANOTHER INFANT TEACHER . THE PLAYGROUND WAS ALL MUDDY AND THERE WAS A SCRAPPER AT THE DOOR SO THAT THEY COULD CLEAN OF THE MUD. THERE WERE TWO ENTRANCES, ONE FOR THE GIRLS AND THE OTHER FOR THE BOYS. THE TOILETS WERE OUTSIDE AND IN WINTER THE TEACHER HAD TO BREAK THE ICE BEFORE THEY COULD BE USED. IT WAS COLD BECAUSE THERE WAS ONLY ONE COAL FIRE AND A VENTILATOR IN THE FLOOR WHICH LET IN VERY COLD AIR .THERE WAS NO ELECTRICITY AND THEY HAD TO DO THINGS LIKE SINGING WHEN IT GOT TOO DARK IN WINTER.YOU LEFT SCHOOL ON THE DAY YOU WERE FOURTEEN YOU HAD TO SIT IN ROWS AND YOU WERE NOT ALLOWED TO TALK AT ALL..
